Package bricker.brick_strategies

Class ExtraPaddleStrategy

  • java.lang.Object
    • bricker.brick_strategies.BasicCollisionStrategy
      • bricker.brick_strategies.ExtraPaddleStrategy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CollisionStrategy
    public class ExtraPaddleStrategy
extends BasicCollisionStrategy
    ExtraPaddleStrategy is a collision strategy class that extends BasicCollisionStrategy. It is designed to add a paddle to the game when certain collision conditions are met. This strategy is activated upon a collision event, and it checks if the conditions for adding an extra paddle are met (e.g., checking the lives of the extra paddles). If the conditions are satisfied, it creates and adds an extra paddle to the game, enhancing the player's ability to interact with the game. Usage: - Instantiate this class with the necessary game components. - Attach this strategy to a GameObject. When a collision occurs, the strategy will check the conditions and add an extra paddle if appropriate.
    Version:
    Java 11
    Author:
    Noam Shabat, Samuel Hayat

    • Constructor Detail

      • ExtraPaddleStrategy

        public ExtraPaddleStrategy​(danogl.collisions.GameObjectCollection gameObjects,
                           danogl.gui.rendering.Renderable extraPaddleRenderable,
                           danogl.gui.UserInputListener inputListener,
                           danogl.util.Vector2 windowDimensions,
                           danogl.util.Counter extraPaddlesLives)
        Constructor for the ExtraPaddleStrategy class. Initializes the strategy with all necessary components and settings required to add an extra paddle in the game.
        Parameters:
        gameObjects - The collection of all game objects. Used to add the extra paddle to the game.
        extraPaddleRenderable - The renderable object to represent the extra paddle.
        inputListener - The listener for user inputs, essential for controlling the extra paddle.
        windowDimensions - The dimensions of the game window, used for positioning the extra paddle.
        extraPaddlesLives - A counter representing the lives or instances of extra paddles in the game.

    • Method Detail

      • getTag

        public java.lang.String getTag()
        Returns a unique tag identifying this specific strategy. This tag can be used for debugging or identifying the strategy during the game.
        Specified by:
        getTag in interface CollisionStrategy
        Overrides:
        getTag in class BasicCollisionStrategy
        Returns:
        A string representing the tag of this collision strategy.

      • onCollision

        public void onCollision​(danogl.GameObject thisObj,
                        danogl.GameObject otherObj,
                        danogl.util.Counter bricksCounter,
                        boolean originalBehavior)
        Handles the collision event and potentially adds an extra paddle to the game. This method is invoked when a collision occurs with an object implementing this strategy. It checks certain conditions (e.g., the life of the extra paddle) and, if met, adds a new extra paddle.
        Specified by:
        onCollision in interface CollisionStrategy
        Overrides:
        onCollision in class BasicCollisionStrategy
        Parameters:
        thisObj - The GameObject that this strategy is attached to.
        otherObj - The GameObject that has collided with thisObj.
        bricksCounter - A counter tracking the number of bricks in the game.
        originalBehavior - A boolean flag indicating whether the original behavior of the collision should also occur.
